translation: opat [a man who is the head of a monastery or an abbey]
sentence: And every bishop, abbot and abbess who is able to do so is to give a pound of silver in alms.

translation: szambo [a large underground hole or container that is used for collecting and storing solid waste, urine, and dirty water]
sentence: There is no municipal water-supply, and the main drain of the city discharges into the lower pool of Siloam, which has become an open cesspit.

translation: sedno [the most important or serious part of a matter, problem, or argument]
sentence: Now we come to the crux of the matter.

translation: świt [the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky]
sentence: Only at daybreak, however, was it discovered that oil was being discharged into the sea.

translation: dekret, zarządzenie [an official statement that something must happen]
sentence: More than 200 people were freed by military decree.

translation: uczeń [a person who believes in the ideas and principles of someone famous and tries to live the way that person does or did]
sentence: He and his disciples had come to know each other in many ways during their time together.

translation: pęknięcie, szczelina [a long, deep crack in something, especially in rock or in the earth]
sentence: The other fissures have been destroyed by quarrying operations.

translation: rzucać, ciskać, wykonać gwałtowny ruch [to throw something or someone suddenly and with a lot of force; to move or do something quickly and energetically]
sentence: He crumpled up the letter and flung it into the fire. She flung her arms around his neck.

translation: skrupulatny [very careful and with great attention to every detail]
sentence: Many hours of meticulous preparation have gone into writing the book.
They were very obliging and offered to wait for us.

translation: usadowić się, siadać [(of a bird) to land and stay on a branch, etc.]
sentence: A robin was perching on the fence.

translation: zaniepokoić, zatrwożyć [to make someone worried or anxious]
sentence: News of the arrest perturbed her greatly.

translation: skłonność, pociąg (do czegoś) [formal; the fact that someone is likely to behave in a particular way, especially a bad way]
sentence: He's well-known for his natural propensity for indiscretion.

translation: objawienie, rewelacja [the act of making something known that was secret, or a fact that is made known]
sentence: Shocking revelations about their private life appeared in the papers.

translation: chusta, szal [a large piece of cloth worn by a woman around the shoulders or head, or wrapped around a baby]
sentence: Princess Mary threw a shawl over her head and ran to meet the newcomer.
